text: A businessman stands before a room full of teachers, ready to deliver his speech.
Image Description: Businessman giving a presentation to teachers illustration

text: He believes schools need to be run like businesses, emphasizing efficiency and quality.
Image Description: Businessman with a graph showing efficiency and quality

text: A veteran English teacher challenges his assumptions.
Image Description: English teacher with a stern expression

text: She asks him about dealing with inferior blueberries in his ice cream business.
Image Description: Blueberries in a basket, some good, some bad

text: He proudly explains he sends them back.
Image Description: Businessman pointing at blueberries with a disapproving look

text: The teacher delivers a powerful retort:
Image Description: Teacher with a determined expression, pointing at a diverse group of children

text: She lists the challenges faced by schools, emphasizing the unique and diverse needs of each student.
Image Description: Different children with various backgrounds and abilities

text: The teachers erupt in cheers, shouting
Image Description: Teachers cheering and holding up blueberries

text: The businessman realizes the profound difference between running a business and running a school.
Image Description: Businessman with a thoughtful expression, looking at a group of children

text: He understands that schools reflect the community they serve and that change requires a collective effort.
Image Description: Community members working together to support a school

text: The Blueberry Story reminds us that education is about nurturing every child, regardless of their background or challenges.
Image Description: Children of different ages and backgrounds learning together
